metadata.title: CVE-2024-0567 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in GnuTLS, where a cockpit (which uses gnuTLS)rejects a certificate chain with distributed trust. This issue occurs whenvalidating a certificate chain with cockpit-certificate-ensure. This flawallows an unauthenticated, remote client or attacker to initiate a denialof service attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnutls-bin - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.9
guile-gnutls - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.9
libgnutls-dane0 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.9
libgnutls-openssl27 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.9
libgnutls30 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.9
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.6.13-2ubuntu1.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnutls28 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.13-2ubuntu1.9').
